Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with the first few events (1-3), the temperature is around 20C, pressure is 1 bar, vibration is 0, material flow is 0, tool position is 0, and energy is around 0.4-0.5 kWh. These might be the machine idling or in standby mode since theres no activity indicated by the other sensors.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Events 1-3 could be a setup or initial state before starting any real work. Label: Idle/Startup.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Then, event 4 jumps to 50C, vibration increases to 30 Hz, material flow starts at 5 units/s, tool position moves to 5mm, and energy goes up to 2kWh. This sudden change suggests the start of an activity.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Continuing from events 4-6, the temperature and vibration keep increasing, maybe indicating the machine is in the middle of the process. Looking for clusters: Events 4-6: High temp, high vibration, material flow 5. Could be Cutting since high temp and vibration during cutting metal. The high material flow (5 units/s) might be feeding material into a cutting tool. The tool position is increasing, maybe moving the cutting tool.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Maybe cutting or some process that requires more energy and movement. The temperature and vibration are higher, so perhaps a cutting operation where the tool is moving (tool position increasing) and using more energy. The material flow here is 5, which might be raw material being fed into the process. Label: Cutting Metal (4-6).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Then at event 7, temperature drops to 40C, vibration lowers to 10 Hz, material flow drops to 2 units/s, and tool position is 15mm. The energy is still moderate. Looking at events 7-8: Temp drops to 40, vibration down to 10, flow 2, tool at 15. Maybe a transition or a different process like assembling parts? Lower activity but still some movement.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: This could be a different phase, maybe assembling parts? Lower vibration and temperature might mean less intense activity but still some movement (tool position at 15mm). But the material flow is still present, so maybe handling parts rather than cutting. Label: Assembling (7-8).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Wait, but then in event 9, temperature spikes to 80C, vibration jumps to 50 Hz, material flow drops to 0, and energy peaks at 5kWh. Thats a big jump. High temperature and vibration with no material flow might indicate welding, since welding often requires high heat and maybe some vibration from the welding process.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: That's a big jump. Could be welding, which requires high heat. The material flow is 0 because maybe its joining parts without feeding new material. Label: Welding (9).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Then event 10 drops back down to lower numbers again, so maybe the end of welding. After that, events 11-12 have lower readings again but with some activity: temperature 25C, vibration 5 Hz, material flow 1, tool position 20mm, energy 1.5kWh.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Wait, but after welding (event9), the next event (10) has temp 30, which is a big drop. Maybe a cooldown phase, but that's part of the post-welding phase, but perhaps its part of the inspection. Alternatively, event10 could be a cooldown, but then events11-12 start again with some activity.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Maybe this is quality inspection or packaging. Maybe moving parts (tool position changing) but not as intense as before. The lower material flow might be feeding a part for inspection or packaging. Alternatively, inspection might involve moving parts under a sensor, hence the tool movement and some energy use. Label: Quality Inspection (10-12).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Finally, events 13-15 drop back to zero or near-zero, similar to the start, so maybe shutdown or end of the process.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Events 13-15: Back to idle. Label: Shutdown/Idle (13-15).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Putting it all together, the phases are: 1. Startup (1-3), 2. Cutting (4-6), 3. Assembling (7-8), 4. Welding (9), 5. Quality Inspection (10-12), 6. Shutdown (13-15). This sequence (Cut -> Assemble -> Weld -> Inspect) is logical for manufacturing.
